p: In contrast, 2-ethyl-6-methyl-3-hydroxypyridine succinate (mexidol, emoxipine) has noticeable iron chelating activity (Andrusishina et al. 2014), antioxidative activity (Voronina 2001) and the ability to inhibit serine proteases and matrix metalloproteases (Akhmedov, Budylgin and Dolgikh 2010). Mexidol has many such biological effects and has been proposed for the effective use as a supportive agent in the treatment of pneumonia (Ilyashenko et al. 2001; Luzhnikov et al. 2006) and viral infections (Pavelkina, Yerovichenkov and Pak 2010).
